topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Block Storage Overview

section.title: About Block Storage
section.p: HP Helion OpenStack Block Storage Volume Operations uses the OpenStack Cinder (block storage) service to manage storage volumes, including creating volumes, creating volume snapshots, and configuring volumes.
Once created, you can disconnect block storage volumes from one instance and attach them to another. And you can create snapshots of these volumes.
Helion OpenStack 2.0 supports the following storage back ends for block storage volumes and backup datastore configuration:

ul.li:
Volumes
VSA; for more information, see .
3PAR FC or iSCSI; for more information, see .
VMDK; for more information, see Modify the Volume Configuration File.
